intro: Hylotelephium malacophyllum, commonly known as the pink stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountains of China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish flowers. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help it retain water, making it well adapted to arid environments. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
